Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from three fragments) of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; elaborate floral motif in added white and added red above two white bands; exterior: reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number '10' is written in faint ink on the exterior surface.
Bibliographic references: Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (p. 352, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1199) (phase 2)
